data.title: This Week in Tech Earnings
data.text: Brent Thill, Jefferies analyst, discusses the weeks' tech earnings with Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Tech Continues to Dominate
data.text: The market’s rebound has been following the surge from a select group of elite tech stocks. Why tech’s dominance won’t be ending anytime soon.

data.title: CDC criteria for digital contact tracing opens door for Apple-Google approach
data.text: The CDC recommends a broadcasting system for contact tracing apps that leaves the door open to the version backed by Apple and Google.

data.title: Tech Sector Shows its Earnings Power
data.text: Tech Sector Shows its Earnings Power

data.title: Big Tech’s Worries Should Worry You
data.text: When the most successful companies are anxious, you know we’re in scary times.

data.title: Tech Giant Posts Amazing Earnings Growth
data.text: Tech companies offering cloud and online experiences are finding people are using their services more than ever.

data.title: Why Alphabet Stock Is Up
data.text: Many companies have scaled back their ad spending substantially. How is Google parent Alphabet holding up against this environment?

data.title: In spite of pandemic (or maybe because of it), cloud infrastructure revenue soars
data.text: It’s fair to say that even before the impact of COVID-19, companies had begun a steady march to the cloud.

data.title: Facebook, Google and Snap have found their knight in shining armor as ad spending craters
data.text: As pandemic-related impacts started to cut advertiser budgets with big tech companies in the first quarter, one area of spend spend appeared to stay strong: Direct response.

data.title: Strong Earnings Pave the Path for GOOG Stock to Top $1,400
data.text:
GOOG stock is a long-term winner weathering the near-term novel coronavirus storm with impressive resilience. 
The post Strong Earnings Pave the Path for GOOG Stock to Top $1,400 appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Big tech and ad firms were relatively unscathed by declining ad revenue in Q1, but Q2 outlook is darker
data.text: But though there appeared to be some green shoots from the tech giants in the realm of advertising, companies warned impacts will be felt in the second quarter and, in some areas, beyond.

data.title: The Most Important Takeaway That Drove Both Facebook and Alphabet Stocks Higher After Earnings
data.text: Executives from both companies echoed an important trend of interest to investors.
